intro: Vicoa sahyadrica, commonly known as the Sahyadri vicoa, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom during the monsoon season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
